title: OGAE Second Chance Contest
summary: The OGAE Second Chance Contest is a visual event which was founded in 1987 and is organised by branches of OGAE, the international fan club of the Eurovision Song Contest.  Four nations competed in the first contest which took place in 1987.[1]  The contest was previously a non-televised event, but evolved over the years by the usage of video tape and later DVD and YouTube.[1]
